subject: Pass kwargs to auth plugins
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-11 19:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/auth/identity/v3.py'], 'message': 'Pass kwargs to auth plugins

Auth plugins must sometimes affect the Headers and other portions
of the network setup.  Examples:  Kerberos needs to set the
negotiate header.  X509 to provide the client certificate.

This change makes that capability available to the Auth plugins.

Those plugins will live in separate repositories. There are no
dependent patches for it in this repository.

This was split out by Adam Young from the Kerberos Client patch
written by Jose Castro Leon

Change-Id: Iab7287888e4b3f199b9035c1a24ac43639b5027b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pass kwargs to auth plugins

Auth plugins must sometimes affect the Headers and other portions
of the network setup.  Examples:  Kerberos needs to set the
negotiate header.  X509 to provide the client certificate.

This change makes that capability available to the Auth plugins.

Those plugins will live in separate repositories. There are no
dependent patches for it in this repository.

This was split out by Adam Young from the Kerberos Client patch
written by Jose Castro Leon

commit_message:
trustor_user_id not available in v2 trust token

The trust information in the v2 token is missing the trustor_user_id
and impersonation values. This means you are unable to tell who gave
you the trust.

Change-Id: I7ed215b3353079d8ed9514c586d256c1226a2c19
Closes-bug: #1331882
DocImpact

commit_message:
Handle invalid JSON filters from the input gracefully

When there is a invalid JSON string on the input for e.g. query-alarm-history
at present the exception raised is un-caught causing a internal error
with a HTTP error 500 returned to the client. This fix will handle those
errors and return 400 error with proper message indicating the failure.

Change-Id: Icd81a88f2c29a8baf7993325bf423435f1ad0924
Closes-Bug: 1366215

commit_message:
Fix config generator to use keystonemiddleware

The auth_token middleware was moved from keystoneclient.middleware
to keystonemiddleware. The config generator is configured to point
to the new location.

Closes-Bug: #1366594
Change-Id: I5543973b2c7ac06c048686c24354ecf6eb251027

commit_message:
update autoscaling example with floating ip for lb pool

this patch updates autoscaling.yaml to (a) require an
external_network_id parameter and (b) to allocate a floating ip address
and associate it with the loadbalancer pool.

it adds a website_url output to make it consisent with some of the other
Wordpress examples.

Change-Id: I2669f51145fc6fbf20da831995acfa17e9291f66

commit_message:
Delete expired objects in slightly smarter way.

When the expirer tries to delete customer objects, if it just walks through the
containers in order the deamon will tend to send DELETEs to the same container
highly concurrently. This will in turn create a lot of asyncs because of all
the concurrent deletes. If the deletes were spread out to multiple containers
it would improve performance and decrease the number of asyncs made.

Change-Id: I3d08118c197b7f18dd7e880bd5664508934ffd24

Cleanup neutron default security groups on tenant deletion

This fix cleanups tenant default security groups that are
automatically created and must be deleted on tenant deletion

commit_message:
Replace confusing member name

Replace the member name 'data' in test_object_slo.py and
test_object_temp_url_negative.py with 'content', because 'data' member
is used as a class member name for the instace of DataGenerator in the parent
BaseObjectTest class.

Change-Id: I24f102531afaffd7e797e588777d4621be7a1084
Closes-bug: #1276835

subject: Restrict keystone cross-tenant ACLs to IDs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@hpe.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Restrict keystone cross-tenant ACLs to IDs

The keystoneauth middleware supports cross-tenant access
control using the syntax <tenant>:<user> in container ACLs,
where <tenant> and <user> may be either a unique id or a
name. The keystone v3 API introduces the notion of domains -
names are unique within domains but no longer globally unique.
The use of unqualified tenant and user names in this ACL
syntax is therefore not 'safe' in a keystone v3 environment,
and we do not believe it is possible to unambiguously express
domain name qualification using the existing syntax.

This patch modifies keystoneauth middleware to detect when an
auth token has been validated against the keystone v3 API, and
if so restrict the cross-tenant ACL matching to use only ids.
(Note that authtoken middleware will only validate a token
against the v3 keystone API if explicity configured to
do so using the option auth_version = v3.0).

A keystoneauth config option is provided for users who wish
to override this behaviour and continue to match names
in ACLs.

This change obviously impacts users accustomed to specifying
cross-tenant ACLs in terms of names, and further work will be
necessary to restore those use cases. Some ideas are
discussed under the bug report. With that caveat, this patch
removes the reported vulnerability when using
swift/keystoneauth with a keystone v3 API.

Closes-Bug:  #1299146

Change-Id: Ib32df093f7450f704127da77ff06b595f57615cb

", 'number': 9}, {'created': '2014-06-17 14:59:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Restrict keystone cross-tenant ACLs to IDs

The keystoneauth middleware supports cross-tenant access
control using the syntax <tenant>:<user> in container ACLs,
where <tenant> and <user> may currently be either a unique
id or a name. As a result of the keystone v3 API introducing
domains, names are no longer globally unique and are only
unique within a domain. The use of unqualified tenant and
user names in this ACL syntax is therefore not 'safe' in a
keystone v3 environment.

This patch modifies keystoneauth to restrict cross-tenant
ACL matching to use only ids. For backwards compatibility,
names will still be matched in ACLs when both the requesting
user and the tenant are known to be in the default domain i.e.
the domain to which existing tenants are migrated. However,
names should no longer be used when setting new ACLs in any
account, including new accounts in the default domain.

This change obviously impacts users accustomed to specifying
cross-tenant ACLs in terms of names, and further work will be
necessary to restore those use cases. Some ideas are
discussed under the bug report. With that caveat, this patch
removes the reported vulnerability when using
swift/keystoneauth with a keystone v3 API.

DocImpact

blueprint keystone-v3-support

Closes-Bug:  #1299146

The keystoneauth middleware supports cross-tenant access
control using the syntax <tenant>:<user> in container ACLs,
where <tenant> and <user> may currently be either a unique
id or a name. As a result of the keystone v3 API introducing
domains, names are no longer globally unique and are only
unique within a domain. The use of unqualified tenant and
user names in this ACL syntax is therefore not 'safe' in a
keystone v3 environment.

This patch modifies keystoneauth to restrict cross-tenant
ACL matching to use only ids. For backwards compatibility,
names will still be matched in ACLs when both the requesting
user and the tenant are known to be in the default domain i.e.
the domain to which existing tenants are migrated. However,
names should no longer be used when setting new ACLs in any

This change obviously impacts users accustomed to specifying

necessary to restore those use cases. Some ideas are
discussed under the bug report. With that caveat, this patch
removes the reported vulnerability when using
swift/keystoneauth with a keystone v3 API.

Note: to observe the new 'restricted' behaviour you will need
to setup keystone user(s) and tenant(s) in a non-default domain
and set auth_version = v3.0 in the auth_token middleware config
section of proxy-server.conf. You may also benefit from the
keystone v3 enabled swiftclient patch under review here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91788/

", 'number': 12}, {'created': '2014-06-27 14:57:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Restrict keystone cross-tenant ACLs to IDs

The keystoneauth middleware supports cross-tenant access
control using the syntax <tenant>:<user> in container ACLs,
where <tenant> and <user> may currently be either a unique
id or a name. As a result of the keystone v3 API introducing
domains, names are no longer globally unique and are only
unique within a domain. The use of unqualified tenant and
user names in this ACL syntax is therefore not 'safe' in a
keystone v3 environment.

This patch modifies keystoneauth to restrict cross-tenant
ACL matching to use only ids. For backwards compatibility,
names will still be matched in ACLs when both the requesting
user and tenant are known to be in the default domain AND the
account's tenant is also in the default domain (the default
domain being the domain to which existing tenants are
migrated).

Accounts existing prior to this patch are assumed to be for
tenants in the default domain. New accounts created using a
v2 token scoped on the tenant are also assumed to be in the
default domain. New accounts created using a v3 token scoped
on the tenant will learn their domain membership from the
token info. New accounts created using any unscoped token,
(i.e. with a reselleradmin role) will have unknown domain
membership and therefore be assumed to NOT be in the default
domain.

Despite this provision for backwards compatibility, names
should no longer be used when setting new ACLs in any account,
including new accounts in the default domain.

This change obviously impacts users accustomed to specifying
cross-tenant ACLs in terms of names, and further work will be
necessary to restore those use cases. Some ideas are
discussed under the bug report. With that caveat, this patch
removes the reported vulnerability when using
swift/keystoneauth with a keystone v3 API.

Note: to observe the new 'restricted' behaviour you will need
to setup keystone user(s) and tenant(s) in a non-default domain
and set auth_version = v3.0 in the auth_token middleware config
section of proxy-server.conf. You may also benefit from the
keystone v3 enabled swiftclient patch under review here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91788/

DocImpact

blueprint keystone-v3-support

Closes-Bug:  #1299146

Change-Id: Ib32df093f7450f704127da77ff06b595f57615cb
", 'number': 13}, {'created': '2014-07-08 11:49:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Restrict keystone cross-tenant ACLs to IDs

The keystoneauth middleware supports cross-tenant access
control using the syntax <tenant>:<user> in container ACLs,
where <tenant> and <user> may currently be either a unique
id or a name. As a result of the keystone v3 API introducing

unique within a domain. The use of unqualified tenant and

This patch modifies keystoneauth to restrict cross-tenant
ACL matching to use only ids for accounts that are not in

names will still be matched in ACLs when both the requesting
user and tenant are known to be in the default domain AND the
account's tenant is also in the default domain (the default
domain being the domain to which existing tenants are
migrated).

Accounts existing prior to this patch are assumed to be for
tenants in the default domain. New accounts created using a
v2 token scoped on the tenant are also assumed to be in the
default domain. New accounts created using a v3 token scoped
on the tenant will learn their domain membership from the
token info. New accounts created using any unscoped token,
(i.e. with a reselleradmin role) will have unknown domain
membership and therefore be assumed to NOT be in the default
domain.

Despite this provision for backwards compatibility, names
must no longer be used when setting new ACLs in any account,
including new accounts in the default domain.

This change obviously impacts users accustomed to specifying
cross-tenant ACLs in terms of names, and further work will be
necessary to restore those use cases. Some ideas are
discussed under the bug report. With that caveat, this patch
removes the reported vulnerability when using
swift/keystoneauth with a keystone v3 API.

Note: to observe the new 'restricted' behaviour you will need
to setup keystone user(s) and tenant(s) in a non-default domain
and set auth_version = v3.0 in the auth_token middleware config
section of proxy-server.conf. You may also benefit from the
keystone v3 enabled swiftclient patch under review here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91788/

DocImpact

blueprint keystone-v3-support

Closes-Bug:  #1299146

commit_message:
Restrict keystone cross-tenant ACLs to IDs

The keystoneauth middleware supports cross-tenant access
control using the syntax <tenant>:<user> in container ACLs,
where <tenant> and <user> may currently be either a unique
id or a name. As a result of the keystone v3 API introducing
domains, names are no longer globally unique and are only
unique within a domain. The use of unqualified tenant and
user names in this ACL syntax is therefore not 'safe' in a
keystone v3 environment.

This patch modifies keystoneauth to restrict cross-tenant
ACL matching to use only ids for accounts that are not in
the default domain. For backwards compatibility,
names will still be matched in ACLs when both the requesting
user and tenant are known to be in the default domain AND the
account's tenant is also in the default domain (the default
domain being the domain to which existing tenants are
migrated).

Accounts existing prior to this patch are assumed to be for
tenants in the default domain. New accounts created using a
v2 token scoped on the tenant are also assumed to be in the
default domain. New accounts created using a v3 token scoped
on the tenant will learn their domain membership from the
token info. New accounts created using any unscoped token,
(i.e. with a reselleradmin role) will have unknown domain
membership and therefore be assumed to NOT be in the default
domain.

Despite this provision for backwards compatibility, names
must no longer be used when setting new ACLs in any account,
including new accounts in the default domain.

This change obviously impacts users accustomed to specifying
cross-tenant ACLs in terms of names, and further work will be
necessary to restore those use cases. Some ideas are
discussed under the bug report. With that caveat, this patch
removes the reported vulnerability when using
swift/keystoneauth with a keystone v3 API.

Note: to observe the new 'restricted' behaviour you will need
to setup keystone user(s) and tenant(s) in a non-default domain
and set auth_version = v3.0 in the auth_token middleware config
section of proxy-server.conf. You may also benefit from the
keystone v3 enabled swiftclient patch under review here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91788/

DocImpact

blueprint keystone-v3-support

Closes-Bug:  #1299146

Change-Id: Ib32df093f7450f704127da77ff06b595f57615cb

commit_message:
Fix FormPOST max_file_size exceeded bug.

When using FormPOST, if the size of the file being posted exceeds
max_file_size, a HTTP 499 was being returned rather than HTTP 400.

Change-Id: I48c781735c66eccde3deb6f9c3c184aee964a4a5

commit_message:
Have the EC2 instance test to wait for termination

Several EC2 test did not waited for instance termination.
This change adds an explicit wait for termination,
for the test cases which wants to terminate
the instance inside the test case.

The #1365831 happened because the 'test_run_terminate_instance',
did not waited for the final termination.

Change-Id: Icd3b86ebc8464bd20319e8582541d78fded10ee2
Closes-Bug: #1365831

commit_message:
ceilometer spamming syslog

regression in code which causes ceilometer to spam syslog. this
patch explicitly configures log_level in ceilometer swift
middleware as we no longer rely on swift middleware logic to
configure it.

Change-Id: I248040cb1d842cf89ed32ef28d8575012d36e08f
Closes-Bug: #1367880

commit_message:
Update oslo log module

Changes -
 * Set stevedore log level to WARN by default
 * Add unicode coercion of logged messages to ContextFormatter
 * Correct coercion of logged message to unicode
 * Except socket.error if syslog isn't running
 * Fix E126 pep8 errors
 * Set keystonemiddleware and routes.middleware to log on WARN level
 * Adjust oslo logging to provide adapter is enabled for
 * Make logging_context_format_string optional in log.set_defaults
 * Add default log level for websocket

Change-Id: Ib0529a52c1b6f6328b1022c4a61da752258d01f9

commit_message:
Add oslo.serialization

Add the new Oslo library for managing object serialization. This code is
moving out of the incubator into a library, so projects that wish to
continue using it need the requirement added to the global list first.

NOTE: this is needed for clients installed from master using oslo.serialization.

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt

Partial-Bug: #1366748

Change-Id: Iff29ce2e88cddc2332229cfbbc518251dd2c76f3
(cherry picked from commit 2ce3f8259b56410bdd73deca09b7963f4a46e1da)

commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This causes docs jobs to fail because we error out on warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

commit_message:
VolumeMultiBackendTest: delete error volumes

Record the volume ID before waiting for the volume status to go
available. This means that if the volume goes into error the tearDown
method can remove the volume.

Change-Id: I67e74af999862fc37c4f5b2474b50b62cce328e9
Partial-Bug: #1352498

commit_message:
Document how to add/replace controller node

All in operations guide
- Modified 2320 to introduce subject and source other files
- redeploy subdirectory includes separate files for the actions
- Added steps to add/remove controller nodes

Closes-Bug: 1354586

Change-Id: Ic295b8848c297c2604cdae10d216315b75bdd097

commit_message:
state the fact that NSX Service node is mandatory for Mirantis OpenStack

- NSX cluster can successfully operate without Service node, but our
  tests show that creation of virtual interfaces fails, due to incorrect
  configuration of `replication_mode' setting in Neutron NSX plugin
  confguration file (plugin is configured to use Service node)
- we need more work to be done to implement working Mirantis OpenStack
  with NSX cluster that operates without Service node
- note that OpenStack itself can be used with NSX cluster that lacks
  Service node
- while here add missing article

Change-Id: Ibd88834a525104f4c9e71c355c3e7e0ea833adba
Closes-bug: #1365043

subject: Fix selection of vsphere as non default backend
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 03:49:24.000000000', 'files': ['glance/store/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Fix selection of vsphere as non default backend

When vsphere is not the default backend, selecting
a specific backend over the documented "--store vsphere"
option does not work, since there is a class name check
that checks for vmware_datastore (as that is the name
of the class). However that class only handles the scheme
vmware_datastore. Add an alias hack similar to how
filesystem is handled.

Change-Id: Ifa2922b19f50b978e4ed1a2bf21663163ef8c58d
Fixes-Bug: #1354261
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix selection of vsphere as non default backend

When vsphere is not the default backend, selecting
a specific backend over the documented "--store vsphere"
option does not work, since there is a class name check
that checks for vmware_datastore (as that is the name
of the class). However that class only handles the scheme
vmware_datastore. Add an alias hack similar to how
filesystem is handled.

Change-Id: Ifa2922b19f50b978e4ed1a2bf21663163ef8c58d
Fixes-Bug: #1354261

commit_message:
ResourceGroup build from list of resource names

This changes ResourceGroup internal implementation to be driven by
a list of resource names rather than a count of resources.

This maintains the current behaviour of sequential number resource
names, while allowing subclasses to choose a completely different
resource name scheme.

subject: Reactivating materialized theory tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-05 23:14:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: Reactivating materialized theory tests

One of the features we mothballed before the alpha was
the option to use a theory that explicitly stores the contents
of all tables that are defined via rules.

This change begins reactivating that option
by reactivating the code's tests.

This is a WIP mainly because there's a bug in the theory when
rules get inserted/deleted.  If rules are inserted/deleted
in the same chunk of events that some of the dependent data
is updated, we do not get the right answer.  The reason is
that we are computing the collection of data generated
by the rule when that rule is enqueued, but that event
happens before the queue is processed.  Example..

insert[q(1)]
insert[p(x) :- q(x)].
enqueue[q(1)]
compute-consequences[p(x) :- q(x)] = {}
enqueue[p(x) :- q(x)]
enqueue[{}]
process[q(1)] <- when q(1) actually gets inserted
process[p(x) :- q(x)] <- just inserts rule

Clearly we need to do the data computation at the processing
step instead of at the enqueueing step.

Change-Id: I6f9ee25050d6c6cd42e176335d83b6fb7ac2821d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-08 21:06:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Reactivating materialized theory tests

One of the features we mothballed before the alpha was

This change begins reactivating that option
by reactivating the code's tests.

commit_message:
Reactivating materialized theory tests

One of the features we mothballed before the alpha was
the option to use a theory that explicitly stores the contents
of all tables that are defined via rules.

This change begins reactivating that option
by reactivating the code's tests.

Change-Id: I6f9ee25050d6c6cd42e176335d83b6fb7ac2821d

commit_message:
Resurrected more policy tests

Before the alpha release, we mothballed a number of policy tests and features.
We thought we had saved all the tests for features that were
actually included in the alpha, but we missed some.

This change reactivates those tests.

Change-Id: I42f3ea01d8cb07204321d229de864db43f492c66

commit_message:
Enable filtering of services by name

This commit enables the filtering of services through the service's
name. This wasn't available before, since the name is not saved in the
backend as a column, but instead it's stored as an extra attribute.

Thus, this commits enables this type of search by asserting a TODO that
was left in the SQL backend, and also adding the `name` attribute to the
filterprotected decorator.

This is needed since some clients (namely python-openstackclient) assume
that this functionality already exists and thus give the option to
create endpoints with the service name as a parameter.

Change-Id: Ifc9c1e44e908410740f6f20380b264d35096fcac
Closes-Bug: #1350273

subject: Make generate_password more secure
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 18:15:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/utils.py'], 'message': 'Make generate_password more secure

It appears that the generate_password function in
cinder/volume/utils.py was based on a function from
nova/utils.py .  The version in Nova has been updated
to use random.SystemRandom() to get better random
passwords.

This change brings those changes into Cinder.

NOTE: In the future we should look at getting this function
      moved to Oslo as it is being used in Cinder and Nova.

Change-Id: I3ea4fffbcbf22d7e0de4874dcfb592ecf523b4cc

commit_message:
Make generate_password more secure

It appears that the generate_password function in
cinder/volume/utils.py was based on a function from
nova/utils.py .  The version in Nova has been updated
to use random.SystemRandom() to get better random
passwords.

This change brings those changes into Cinder.

NOTE: In the future we should look at getting this function
      moved to Oslo as it is being used in Cinder and Nova.

Change-Id: I3ea4fffbcbf22d7e0de4874dcfb592ecf523b4cc
Closes-bug: 1368040

commit_message:
Add merge_stderr option to all client methods

This commit makes the client methods behave more uniformly. Before
there only certain methods had a kwarg for merge_stderr, which could
lead to unexpected behavior depending on the clients being used. By
adding the option everywhere there shouldn't be an unexpected behavior
around merge_stderr.

Change-Id: I227d5e684c94da29a47eb9876a9ed40cdbea084c

commit_message:
Fix the filename copy into the filename input

In horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.form.js,
edited the function handle_object_upload_source.

As the form validation is done by Angular,
the filename change has to be done by Angular (done).
The filename input has to be filled if it has been emptied
(added a condition in the if statement).

Now, when you choose a file, its filename in copied into the filename input
each time you choose a new file and until you manually
change the filename input content.

Change-Id: Ibbebc7ecf2902486db24f50ba12d20facf258581
Closes-Bug: 1364295
Co-Authored-By: Maxime Vidori <maxime.vidori@enovance.com>

subject: Fixed bug for inserting rules via API
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-10 19:42:55.000000000', 'files': ['congress/api/error_codes.py', 'congress/api/rule_model.py'], 'message': 'Fixed bug for inserting rules via API

Previously, if you inserted multiple rules in a single string
via the API, we did not catch the error.  Instead, we simply
processed the first rule.  One symptom of this problem
is an internal server error when someone uses a minus sign
in the middle of a table name, e.g. router-name(x) :- ...
Because of the grammar, this rule would be parsed as two
separate rules: router-() and name(x) :- ...

This change checks that the number of rules sent into
the API is always 1 and shows you the list of rules that
you submitted in the error message.  This helps the user
debug the problem.

Perhaps the grammar should be changed as well, but this
fix is necessary in either case.

Closes-bug: 1367887
Change-Id: I7efec72ef96d6958c1af227d3ef8fb0707703f3b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed bug for inserting rules via API

Previously, if you inserted multiple rules in a single string
via the API, we did not catch the error.  Instead, we simply
processed the first rule.  One symptom of this problem
is an internal server error when someone uses a minus sign
in the middle of a table name, e.g. router-name(x) :- ...
Because of the grammar, this rule would be parsed as two
separate rules: router-() and name(x) :- ...

This change checks that the number of rules sent into
the API is always 1 and shows you the list of rules that
you submitted in the error message.  This helps the user
debug the problem.

Perhaps the grammar should be changed as well, but this
fix is necessary in either case.

Closes-bug: 1367887
Change-Id: I7efec72ef96d6958c1af227d3ef8fb0707703f3b

commit_message:
Updating JobBinaries to use proxy for Swift access

Changes
* refactoring get_raw_binary to accept proxy configs
* refactoring get_raw_data to use proxy Swift connection when necessary
* adding function to get a Swift Connection object from proxy user
* refactoring upload_job_files_to_hdfs and upload_job_files to use proxy
  user when necessary
* changing JobBinary JSON schema to allow blank username/password if
  proxy domains are being used
* adding function to get the Swift public endpoint for the current
  project
* adding test for JobBinary creation without credentials

Partial-implements: blueprint edp-swift-trust-authentication
Change-Id: I02e76016194fbbb62b8ab7b304eecc53d580a79c

commit_message:
Compute v2 api server status value cleanup

Server status need to be updated to reflect current standards.
Adding statuses like STOPPED, PAUSED, SOFT_DELETED and updating
old values to new ones like RESCUED, RESIZED, DELETED.

commit_message:
labs: split out process_begin_files

Move the processing of *.begin status files into a separate function.
Call that function only if the host's status directory is shared with
the client scripts (through VirtualBox guest-additions).

Change-Id: I7716528c02aa4f8b5fc0901ff91ba5d37b5a0d9f

commit_message:
For dse to use eventlets rather than threads

This spec proposes a change to Congress and the DSE to make
the DSE use greenthreads rather than regular threads.

Change-Id: If2ea9a54982c602e60dfda0cfc0852224846e876

commit_message:
Update scripts to initialize heat domain

Updates devtest_{seed,undercloud,overcloud} to use Heat's tool for
creating a stack user domain in Keystone.

Updates the passwords scripts and passwords rc files as well to account
for the additional password.

This depends on If4b4266ce66212d7ae2579e7da6d3bae779ad04a landing in
Heat.

Partial-Bug: #1287453
Change-Id: I5ff23caab9f87baf96007b61b3bd604694f44301
Co-Authored-By: Clint Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>

commit_message:
Ironic:  Fix direct use of flavor and instance module objects

This replaces all uses of nova.objects.flavor_obj.Flavor* with
nova.objects.Flavor* and nova.objects.instance_obj.Instance* with
nova.objects.Instance*

This work was done throughout Nova. An example of this is
commit 3c1085f528596089a638ac3bb44a9ed3e201e62f.

Change-Id: I8f2dbb408acbdf8124bc141925de03ce6f12bd91

commit_message:
Add heat-keystone-setup-domain to sphinx conf.py

The man page for heat-keystone-setup-domain was not being generated
because it was not included in the sphinx conf.py.

Change-Id: Ic1c2025fc7f61e3c37906b42bd84e1df893920fc

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-18 13:58:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: synchronize handle_lifecycle_event to avoid stop race error

Commit cc5388bbe81aba635fb757e202d860aeed98f3e8 added locks to
stop_instance and the _sync_power_states periodic task to try and fix a
race between stopping the instance via the API where the task_state is
set to powering-off, and the periodic task seeing the instance
power_state as shutdown in _sync_instance_power_state and calling the
stop API again, at which point the task_state is already None from the
first stop API call and we get an UnexpectedTaskStateError.

That change missed the call to _sync_instance_power_state in
handle_lifecycle_event which is also detecting power state changes via
events and automatically stopping the instance, which also races with
stop_instance, so this change adds the lock to handle_lifecycle_event
also.

Closes-Bug: #1339235
Closes-Bug: #1266611
Related-Bug: #1320628

Change-Id: Ib495a5ab15de88051c5fa7abfb58a5445691dcad
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-18 17:39:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: synchronize handle_lifecycle_event to avoid stop race error

Commit cc5388bbe81aba635fb757e202d860aeed98f3e8 added locks to
stop_instance and the _sync_power_states periodic task to try and fix a
race between stopping the instance via the API where the task_state is
set to powering-off, and the periodic task seeing the instance
power_state as shutdown in _sync_instance_power_state and calling the
stop API again, at which point the task_state is already None from the
first stop API call and we get an UnexpectedTaskStateError.

That change missed the call to _sync_instance_power_state in
handle_lifecycle_event which is also detecting power state changes via
events and automatically stopping the instance, which also races with
stop_instance, so this change adds the lock to handle_lifecycle_event
also.

Adds debug logging to handle_lifecycle_event and stop_instance to
dump the current instance state after acquiring the lock.

Closes-Bug: #1339235
Closes-Bug: #1266611
Related-Bug: #1320628

Change-Id: Ib495a5ab15de88051c5fa7abfb58a5445691dcad
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-25 19:00:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: synchronize handle_lifecycle_event to avoid stop race error

Commit cc5388bbe81aba635fb757e202d860aeed98f3e8 added locks to
stop_instance and the _sync_power_states periodic task to try and fix a
race between stopping the instance via the API where the task_state is
set to powering-off, and the periodic task seeing the instance
power_state as shutdown in _sync_instance_power_state and calling the
stop API again, at which point the task_state is already None from the
first stop API call and we get an UnexpectedTaskStateError.

That change missed the call to _sync_instance_power_state in
handle_lifecycle_event which is also detecting power state changes via
events and automatically stopping the instance, which also races with
stop_instance, so this change adds the lock to handle_lifecycle_event
also.

Adds debug logging to handle_lifecycle_event and stop_instance to
dump the current instance state after acquiring the lock.

Also adds a check for UnexpectedTaskStateError when the sync instance
power state method calls compute_api.force_stop since it's an
asynchronous call so we can still get that error, but it shouldn't
stacktrace since the sync method should basically ignore anything
going through a task state change.

Closes-Bug: #1339235
Closes-Bug: #1266611
Related-Bug: #1320628

Change-Id: Ib495a5ab15de88051c5fa7abfb58a5445691dcad

", 'number': 8}, {'created': '2014-07-30 06:20:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Stop stack tracing when trying to auto-stop a stopped instance

Commit cc5388bbe81aba635fb757e202d860aeed98f3e8 added locks to
stop_instance and the _sync_power_states periodic task to try and fix a
race between stopping the instance via the API where the task_state is
set to powering-off, and the periodic task seeing the instance
power_state as shutdown in _sync_instance_power_state and calling the
stop API again, at which point the task_state is already None from the
first stop API call and we get an UnexpectedTaskStateError.

The handle_lifecycle_event method is getting callbacks from the libvirt
driver on state changes on the VM and calling the
_sync_instance_power_state method which may try to stop the instance
asynchronously, and lead to UnexpectedTaskStateError if the instance is
already stopped by the time it gets the lock and the task_state has
changed.

Attempting to lock in handle_lifecycle_event just moves the race around
so this change adds logic to stop_instance such that if the instance
says it's active but the virt driver says it's not running, then we add
None to the expected_task_state so we don't stacktrace on
instance.save().

An alternative and/or additional change to this would be doing a call
rather than a cast when _sync_instance_power_state calls the stop API
but in some previous testing it doesn't appear to make a significant
difference in the race found when we hit the stop_instance method.

Adds a bunch of debug logging since this code is inherently racey and
is needed when looking at failures around these operations.

Closes-Bug: #1339235
Closes-Bug: #1266611
Related-Bug: #1320628

Change-Id: Ib495a5ab15de88051c5fa7abfb58a5445691dcad

commit_message:
Stop stack tracing when trying to auto-stop a stopped instance

Commit cc5388bbe81aba635fb757e202d860aeed98f3e8 added locks to
stop_instance and the _sync_power_states periodic task to try and fix a
race between stopping the instance via the API where the task_state is
set to powering-off, and the periodic task seeing the instance
power_state as shutdown in _sync_instance_power_state and calling the
stop API again, at which point the task_state is already None from the
first stop API call and we get an UnexpectedTaskStateError.

The handle_lifecycle_event method is getting callbacks from the libvirt
driver on state changes on the VM and calling the
_sync_instance_power_state method which may try to stop the instance
asynchronously, and lead to UnexpectedTaskStateError if the instance is
already stopped by the time it gets the lock and the task_state has
changed.

Attempting to lock in handle_lifecycle_event just moves the race around
so this change adds logic to stop_instance such that if the instance
says it's active but the virt driver says it's not running, then we add
None to the expected_task_state so we don't stacktrace on
instance.save().

An alternative and/or additional change to this would be doing a call
rather than a cast when _sync_instance_power_state calls the stop API
but in some previous testing it doesn't appear to make a significant
difference in the race found when we hit the stop_instance method.

Adds a bunch of debug logging since this code is inherently racey and
is needed when looking at failures around these operations.

Closes-Bug: #1339235
Closes-Bug: #1266611
Related-Bug: #1320628

Change-Id: Ib495a5ab15de88051c5fa7abfb58a5445691dcad

commit_message:
switch to sqlalchemy core

ORM has an overhead associated with it. we need fast writes so
switch to use sqlalchemy core to improve performance.

Closes-Bug: #1356000
Change-Id: I45c76d4f294f9bdb6d0f04e94d4be7e0f7ca6f2a

commit_message:
Add use of nova_kwargs for nova servers create to improve readability

so if we have to add new args to the servers.create call,
we'll be able to use nova_kwargs and avoid mulitple calls
of servers.create with multiple if conditions.

Closes-Bug: 1368109

subject: Fix password leak from ProcessExecution errors
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-11 18:52:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix password leak from ProcessExecution errors

This backport the necessary changes to fix both issues:
* Make execute method clean password in exeception
* Make sure mask_password works properly

The backport is not trivial as these fix relies on many other changes,
only the necesasry code have been imported/adapted.

------------------------------------------------
The sync pulls in the following changes (newest to oldest):

6a60f842 - Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages (ssh)
63c99a0f - Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages
66142c34 - Make strutils.mask_password more secure
d6b55fb2 - Remove `processutils` dependency on `log`
cb5a804b - Move `mask_password` to strutils

-----------------------------------------------

Closes-Bug: 1343604
Closes-Bug: 1345233
SecurityImpact

commit_message:
Fix password leak from ProcessExecution errors

This backport required changes to fix both issues:
* Make execute method clean password in exception
* Make sure mask_password works properly

This backport is not trivial as these fixes relies on many other
changes, only the necessary code have been imported/adapted.

------------------------------------------------
The sync pulls in the following changes (newest to oldest):

63c99a0f - Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages
66142c34 - Make strutils.mask_password more secure
d6b55fb2 - Remove `processutils` dependency on `log`
cb5a804b - Move `mask_password` to strutils

-----------------------------------------------

Closes-Bug: 1343604
Closes-Bug: 1345233
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I3b49b1d667f6ade9ae3f6765d735440a3e838917

commit_message:
Support for setting boot mode in pxe_ilo driver

This commit adds support for setting boot mode in pxe_ilo
driver with the help of iloclient.
It modifies the PXEAndIloDriver so that it uses
IloPower for power management,
IloPXEDeploy for image deployment,
IloPXEVendorPassthru for vendorpassthru,
IPMITool console and management interfaces.

Change-Id: Ifb29c6b4c60ce17a7e5c15af7fb62e1c1e1c9ad7
Implements: blueprint uefi-boot-for-ironic

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-18 11:43:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Method for getting NUMA usage from an instance

At present, neither ResourceTracker nor HostManager use objects
consistently. Due to that - we need to handle numa_topology being both
a json blob, instance of VirtNUMATopology, or None at different places
in the code. In addition to that - it can either be a field in a dict,
a NovaObject attribute, or even an attribute on an object that does not
support .get() interface.

Poluting the VirtNUMAHostTopology.get_usage_from_instances breaks
separation of concerns, and is just poor design, but we do need to go
through the same logic in several places, so we add a convenience method
that knows how to deal with all the different combinations described
above.

Change-Id: I91c3a77153ef8e5e701d3bc7af37ff0a2943fc0c
Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement

commit_message:
Method for getting NUMA usage from an instance

At present, neither ResourceTracker nor HostManager use objects
consistently. Due to that - we need to handle numa_topology being both
a json blob, instance of VirtNUMATopology, or None at different places
in the code. In addition to that - it can either be a field in a dict,
a NovaObject attribute, or even an attribute on an object that does not
support .get() interface.

Polluting the VirtNUMAHostTopology.get_usage_from_instances breaks
separation of concerns, and is just poor design, but we do need to go
through the same logic in several places, so we add a convenience method
that knows how to deal with all the different combinations described
above.

We also add a separated out method for getting the numa_topology out of
all the possible ways we use instance currently, as it will be useful
for filtering to know if the instance actually has a defined
numa_topology.

Change-Id: I91c3a77153ef8e5e701d3bc7af37ff0a2943fc0c
Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement

commit_message:
Add oslo.serialization

Add the new Oslo library for managing object serialization. This code is
moving out of the incubator into a library, so projects that wish to
continue using it need the requirement added to the global list first.

NOTE: this is needed for clients installed from master using oslo.serialization.

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt

Partial-Bug: #1366748

Change-Id: Iff29ce2e88cddc2332229cfbbc518251dd2c76f3
(cherry picked from commit 2ce3f8259b56410bdd73deca09b7963f4a46e1da)

commit_message:
Remove the objectify decorator

The objectify decorator was used to convert DB objects into RPC objects,
but it's not being used anymore since out objects API already has
correspondent methods to match the dbapi ones.

Also, since dbapi methods didn't get a context the decorator was forming
bad RPC objects without a context stored within it.

Change-Id: I892ab6ee2236af040c7f8effcfdfecb293e13ab6
Partial-Bug: #1314732

subject: Use 'configure' instead of 'enable' when talking about kernel function configuration
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 15:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-ml2-compute-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-ml2-network-node.xml'], 'message': "Use 'configure' instead of 'enable' when talking about kernel function configuration

Because we enable and disable kernel networking functions we should
use 'configure' instead of 'enable'.

Change-Id: Ia0aa260bfa49c076ab62fd3a161b986140c7912d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use 'configure' instead of 'enable' when talking about kernel function configuration

Because we enable and disable kernel networking functions we should
use 'configure' instead of 'enable'.

Change-Id: Ia0aa260bfa49c076ab62fd3a161b986140c7912d

commit_message:
Call unbind_snat_servicenode from schedule router

Refactor to move the call to plugin.unbind_snat_servicenode from
schedule_snat_router to _schedule_router.  This is a move to pave the
way for removing hints from schedule router.

Partial-bug: #1353266
Partial-bug: #1356639
Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>

Change-Id: I062d8cc3cb870bbaa033d5b107a7dd868dfafa19

commit_message:
Refacfored a more suitable ovs_redhat provider

  - Added a helper class/library to handle ifcfg content

  - Removed keep_ip and sleep parameters, replaced by
    automatic behaviour

  - No need for a redhat vs_bridge provider

  - Only port/bridge associated with a phyical interface get a
    ifcfg file managed

  - Requires Puppet 2.7.8+
    Not using optional_commands anymore

When the bridge is associated with an active physical interface
  - It will be initially populated from the existing interface
    file, inheriting its parameters

Change-Id: I584fb1442de9a760b3a092f96cbfcbcd6776fdba

commit_message:
Catch NotImplementedError on reset_network for xen

This patch adds a @messaging.expected_exceptions(NotImplementedError)
decorator around reset_network as xen raises NotImplementedError here.

Change-Id: Ib1a0cb400ea89f387cd43630d8c647bf5c99f7ab
Closes-bug: #1306404

commit_message:
Remove templates from toctrees

We don't want the templates to show up in the RSS feed, so exclude them
from being converted to HTML and listed in the toctree.

Change-Id: I8e72a938e007b891720138eb127268a5f950872c

commit_message:
Replace fakes.FakeClient inheritence with Mock

NovaFakeClient had fakes.FakeClient as a super classes.

This dependency broke the build as the interface was not
well defined

Replace the super classe FakeClient with MagicMock and implement
the local return types as mock object

Closes-bug: 1364515
Change-Id: I746daf38f985eba824a5a0759f450766b08b2dab

commit_message:
Shortened tablenames constants in Neutron driver

Previously, the constants for tablenames in the Neutron
driver were all prefixed with NEUTRON_, e.g.
NEUTRON_PORTS_SECURITY_GROUPS.  This prefix is unnecessary
since it is clear from context.

This change removes the prefix throughout the codebase.

Change-Id: Ib9cea8243886523ad639f7151ac593fc3ad21804

commit_message:
Fixed Neutron translation of external_gateway_info

Previously, the translation of the router's external_gateway_info
basically either returned True or False, indicating whether or
not the external_gateway_info was None or not.

This change properly translates external_gateway_info
into either None or a hash table.  It also adds tests
for router and security_group translations.

Change-Id: Ie482d57d6e644bffc9cf0f57a578f04a6e5fabbe

commit_message:
Added schema interface to datasource drivers

Previously, the Nova and Neutron datasource drivers had
different ways of exporting their schemas.

This change introduces an interface for exposing a schema.
The interface consists of one method, 'get_schema', which
returns a dictionary that maps each tablename to a tuple
of column names.

Change-Id: I21d6f5926560a2e720a4e8240381237bdacdfe70

Cleaned up Neutron and Nova drivers

The old drivers were a bit hard for people to understand.

variable naming.

subject: Enhance decorators in agent and automate creation of command_map
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-28 15:03:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove unnecessary argument injection in agent sync and async decorators.

sync_command and async_command in ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py
are implemented so that they change decorated method signature,
which is really bad practice. Example:

@sync_command
def orig_method(self, **kw):
...

sync_command decorator returns lambda which has one additional
argument 'command_name'

def sync_command(func):
    def decorated(self, command_name, **kw):
         ...
         func(self, **kw)
         ...
    return decorated

Additional parameter 'command_name' is removed from decorated function in
both decorators and func.__name__ is used as an argument for
AsyncCommandResult instead. Every call of decorated functions is fixed,
BaseAgentExtension.execute is updated to not send this extra argument.

Change-Id: Iff0f495bc8d9c731892feb0f4759a7f10ee76328
Closes-Bug: #1314148

argument 'command_name'

         ...

         ...
    return decorated

Additional parameter 'command_name' is moved from decorated function to

commit_message:
Enhance decorators in agent and automate creation of command_map

sync_command and async_command in ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py
are implemented so that they change decorated method signature,
which is really bad practice. Example:

@sync_command
def orig_method(self, **kw):
...

sync_command decorator returns lambda which has one additional
argument 'command_name'

def sync_command(func):
    def decorated(self, command_name, **kw):
         ...
         func(self, **kw)
         ...
    return decorated

Additional parameter 'command_name' is moved from decorated function to
decorator signature in both decorators. Every call of decorated functions
is fixed, BaseAgentExtension.execute is updated to not send this extra
argument. BaseAgentExtension.__init__ automatically generates command_map
from decorated methods.

Change-Id: Iff0f495bc8d9c731892feb0f4759a7f10ee76328
Closes-Bug: 1314148

This patch adds support for configuring the api_extensions
option of the various feature-$service-(enabled|disabled)
sections in tempest's configuration file.

Please note that enabled extensions for the object storage
service are specified in tempest using the discoverable_apis

commit_message:
Configure enabled and disabled extensions in tempest

This patch adds support for configuring the api_extensions
option of the various feature-$service-(enabled|disabled)
sections in tempest's configuration file.

Please note that enabled extensions for the object storage
service are specified in tempest using the discoverable_apis
configuration options.

Partially-implements: Blueprint branchless-tempest-extensions

Change-Id: Ib64c0a474b153f42f3a4a427d86275c85f107997

commit_message:
Add 'details' property to VMwareDriverException

The details property of the VimFaultException is very important and we
loose this information when we convert VimFaultException to a specific
subclass of VMwareDriverException. This patch fix this by propagating
the details to VMwareDriverException.

Change-Id: I42a50b60fc74383a2c1d9b907125ff17795ce440

commit_message:
Add two new functions to manipulate with lists

Add list.skip(count) and list.take(count) functions to collect only
a part of original list.

Change-Id: Ic730713f0baad64385e37b36e378615482c7a75d
Closes-bug: #1362892

commit_message:
Skipping dashboard test to unblock gate

The error is only seen in the gate when run in parallel, to ease
contention on the gate, temporarily disabling until a proper
solution has been determined.

Related-Bug: #1345955
Change-Id: I3b61895e3f2b0d96488bef56dc0c6105a212d4dc

commit_message:
nova: support setting scheduler_host_manager

Adds support for setting scheduler_host_manager if
it is set via heat metadata. Previously this
value was hard coded based upon the use of
either Ironic or Nova baremetal.

The motivation here is to be able to use the new Ironic driver
location in the Nova tree.

Change-Id: Id4ca7f90cd85129727e65d0d09f274f3a00d4ebe

commit_message:
Use unlogged batches instead of atomic batches

MagnetoDB API doesn't require atomic batches
so we can improve performance by using unlogged batches

Implements: bp improve-batch-write-performance

Change-Id: I139358ad6424095243f36b7f2a619ed0243ecdfe

commit_message:
Add ceilometer volume and glance notifications ostf tests 

Added ceilometer volume measurements: volume, volume.size
Added ceilometer glance measurements: image, image.size, image.update,
image.upload, image.delete

Partially implements: blueprint ceilometer-ostf-notification-tests

Change-Id: Ie9f3a518bc5e24a4289220385a1e6e0ac0a41305

commit_message:
Add uefi boot mode support in IloVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy

The following functionality need to be added in iLO driver:
  - Add set_boot_mode function to iLO driver to switch between
    bios and uefi boot modes.
  - Validate boot_mode for IloVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy driver.

Change-Id: Ic8496a2d97aab6634b573c85d379b446c49e04b9
Implements: blueprint uefi-boot-for-ironic

subject: Don't write python bytecode while testing
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 12:33:34.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't write python bytecode while testing

This should reduce the number of times you need to do things like git
clean -x -i to kill pyc files in your local directory to get tests to
pass.
It doesn't appear to address pyc files in the .tox directories, and
attempts to address that seem to go in circles. Ideas welcomed.

Change-Id: Ib1e52753bc8c75741067c19ff234999f570762ed
Related-Bug: #1368661
", 'number': 1}]

attempts to address that seem to go in circles. Ideas welcomed.

Remove templates from toctrees

We don't want the templates to show up in the RSS feed, so exclude them
from being converted to HTML and listed in the toctree.

commit_message:
Do not allow to create 5.0-based environments

5.0 releases don't have version suffix, so filter them out by
comparing release version to '2014.1'

Change-Id: I7a1c1e6148e145ba6e89e8d451e21b5de67a4662
Closes-bug: 1368100

subject: Fixed regression in file writing
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 13:27:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixed regression with ZipFile handling

Flags got moved from a to a+ but it's unsupported by ZipFile.

Change-Id: I6ddf14c07e84af0a5e5b0994d72a8bfc506adce0
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-12 13:35:46.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/writer/osrf.py', 'cloudkitty/write_orchestrator.py'], 'message': "Fixed regression in file writing

Flags got moved from a to a+ but it's unsupported by ZipFile.
Changed the name of the write_backend variable but forgot to change it
in the OSRF writer.

Change-Id: I6ddf14c07e84af0a5e5b0994d72a8bfc506adce0
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fixed regression in file writing

Flags got moved from a to a+ but it's unsupported by ZipFile.
Changed the name of the write_backend variable but forgot to change it
in the OSRF writer.

Change-Id: I6ddf14c07e84af0a5e5b0994d72a8bfc506adce0

commit_message:
Debug semaphore creation

Just adds some debugging around when semaphores are created so we
can tell if they're being double-locked or just destroyed and
recreated.

commit_message:
add oslo.utils for testing with Keystoneclient master

stable/* tests run with keystoneclient master and
master keystoneclient will be changing to require
oslo.utils.

Conflicts:

	test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ia29f69731d4dc79e8fc5d14afa932558de387799
Closes-Bug: #1357652
(cherry picked from commit 087550b02b63fdd6ffd5114829591f9b859853ac)

commit_message:
Add code/api documentation

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: I4baea1efa227ef14bc6706d59ff3dcad93c2eacc
Closes-Bug: #1364140

commit_message:
Add API to enable calling module to register an exception

In certain cases the application, for example Nova, may need to treat
a VC exception that is currently not supported by oslo.vmware.

This will enable the application to dynamically add exceptions and then
remove them when oslo.vmware is updated to support the new exception.

The patch also fixes a typo with the exception fault handling.

Change-Id: I332a4ff2ac2c6d4e6ac88bbd067ef0d4e659ffa3

commit_message:
Add mechanism for generation action parameters

 * Add getting human-readable params for adding
   to action
 * Add getting description for action
 * Parameters and description is already generated
   for std_actions
 * Unit tests

TODO:
  * Add the same for OpenStack Actions

Change-Id: I2f2a8ebe3bc3e75ab53f985adcecb59c0f1d7d8b
